endpoints.summary: Get a list of Snyk Apps installed for a Group

details.description:
Get a list of Snyk Apps installed for a Group

#### Required permissions

- `View Apps (group.app.read)`

200.description: A list of apps installed for the specified group.

details.summary: Get a list of Snyk Apps installed for a Group

endpoints.summary: Install a Snyk App for a Group

details.description:
Install a Snyk App to this group, the Snyk App must use unattended authentication e.g. client credentials

#### Required permissions

- `Install Apps (group.app.install)`
details.summary: Install a Snyk App for a Group

endpoints.summary: Revoke app authorization for a Snyk group with install ID

details.description:
Revoke app authorization for a Snyk group with install ID

#### Required permissions

- `Install Apps (group.app.install)`

204.description: The Snyk App install is revoked, with no content (no errors).

details.summary: Revoke app authorization for a Snyk group with install ID

endpoints.summary: Manage client secret for non-interactive Snyk App installations

details.description:
Manage client secret for non-interactive Snyk App installations

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Apps (group.app.edit)`

mode.description:
Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated
secret
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value

secret.description: Secret to delete when using `delete` mode

details.summary: Manage client secret for non-interactive Snyk App installations

endpoints.summary: Get a list of app bots authorized to an organization.

details.description:
Get a list of app bots authorized to an organization. Deprecated, use /orgs/{org_id}/apps/installs instead.

#### Required permissions

- `View Apps (org.app.read)`

200.description: A list of app bots authorized to the specified organization

details.summary: Get a list of app bots authorized to an organization.

details.description:
Revoke app bot authorization. Deprecated, use /orgs/{org_id}/apps/installs/{install_id} instead.

#### Required permissions

- `Install Apps (org.app.install)`

parameters.description: The ID of the app bot
parameters.name: bot_id

204.description: The app bot has been deauthorized

  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value

endpoints.summary: Revoke app authorization for a Snyk organization with install ID

Revoke app authorization for a Snyk organization with install ID

#### Required permissions

- `Install Apps (org.app.install)`

204.description: The Snyk App install is revoked, with no content (no errors).

details.summary: Revoke app authorization for a Snyk organization with install ID

ClientId.description: The OAuth2 client id for the app installation. Only provided for installations of non-interactive Snyk Apps.

RedirectUris.description:
List of allowed redirect URIs (OAuth callbacks) where Snyk will redirect users after authorization.

These are URLs controlled by your application that Snyk will send the user to after they authorize your app. 
The redirect URI used in your authorization request must exactly match one of the URIs registered here.

**Important:** The redirect URI in your OAuth authorization request must be an exact match (including protocol, domain, path, and query parameters) to one of the URIs specified in this list.

**Example valid redirect URI:** `https://example.com/callback` or `https://myapp.example.com/auth/snyk/callback`

For more information on the complete OAuth workflow, see the [Snyk Apps API tutorial](https://docs.snyk.io/snyk-api/using-specific-snyk-apis/snyk-apps-apis/tutorial-create-a-snyk-app).

ClientSecret.description: The oauth2 client secret for the app. This is the only time this secret will be returned, store it securely and don’t lose it.

AppName.description: New name of the app to display to users during authorization flow.

ClientId__1.description: The OAuth2 client id for the app when available. If an app can have multiple OAuth2 clients then this field with return all zeros. This field is not present for such apps in future versions of this api.

IsConfidential20220311.description: A boolean to indicate if an app is confidential or not as per the OAuth2 RFC.

GrantType20220311.description: An authorization grant is a credential representing the resource owner's authorization (to access its protected resources) used by the client to obtain an access token.

RedirectUrisNoMin.description:
List of allowed redirect URIs (OAuth callbacks) where Snyk will redirect users after authorization.

These are URLs controlled by your application that Snyk will send the user to after they authorize your app. 
The redirect URI used in your authorization request must exactly match one of the URIs registered here.

**Important:** The redirect URI in your OAuth authorization request must be an exact match (including protocol, domain, path, and query parameters) to one of the URIs specified in this list.

**Example valid redirect URI:** `https://example.com/callback` or `https://myapp.example.com/auth/snyk/callback`

For more information on the complete OAuth workflow, see the [Snyk Apps API tutorial](https://docs.snyk.io/snyk-api/using-specific-snyk-apis/snyk-apps-apis/tutorial-create-a-snyk-app).

GrantType.description: An authorization grant is a credential representing the resource owner's authorization (to access its protected resources) used by the client to obtain an access token. The grant type represents the way your app will get the access token.

Scopes.description: The scopes this app is allowed to request during authorization.

Context.description: Allow installing the app to a org/group or to a user, default tenant.

InstalledAt.description: Timestamp at which this app was first installed at.

Context__0.description: Allow installing the app to at  org/group level or user level. Defaults to tenant.

AccessTokenTtlSeconds.description: The access token time to live for your app, in seconds. It only affects the newly generated access tokens, existing access token will  continue to have their previous time to live as expiration.

IsPublic.description: A boolean to indicate if an app is publicly available or not.

ClientSecret20240523.description: The OAuth2 client secret for the app. This is the only time this secret will be returned, store it securely and don’t lose it. Only provided for installations of non-interactive Snyk Apps.

ClientId__0.description: The oauth2 client id for the app.

IsConfidential.description: A boolean to indicate if an app is confidential or not as per the OAuth2 RFC. Confidential apps can securely store secrets. Examples of non-confidential apps are full web-based or CLIs.
